ovdesc.p: FATCA TAX BASE is updated automatically at year end with the details of name, address, TIN, Account balances and owner details,
Since it is a live file, a provision is required to add records to the base, modify existing records in the base and delete records from the base.
The ID of FATCA BASE MANUAL UPDATE will be the same as the ID of the FATCA TAX BASE record that needs to be amended .

desc.p: The field is used to identify the action to be performed on the base.
NEW will be used to add records to the base for clients missing from the base;
Amend will be for amending the records in the base; Delete will be for deleting the entire record from the base.
For Amend and Delete the record should already exist in the base.
NEW, AMEND or DELETE.
The field associated with the field in FIELD NAME MV above for which the value needs to be changed (e.g. ACC BALANCE) .
A field, in FATCA TAX BASE, that is part of the associated multi-value set with the field in FIELD NAME MV.
The new value for the field in ASSOC FIELD NAME above.
A valid value for the field being amended
The name of the field, in FATCA TAX BASE, for which the value needs to be added (New/Amend function) or Changed (Amend).
A field in FATCA TAX BASE

The field will be used to change the values of associated multi-value fields. Only the first field in an associated multi-value set from the base (e.g. Relation Cust for changing the ownership details, Account for the Account balance details) can be specified here
A field, in FATCA TAX BASE, that is the first field of an associated multi-value set.
The field is used to specify the new value for the field in FIELD.NAME.
If the field value is blank or Null, then while amending, the existing field values will be cleared.
A valid value for the field
The value of the field, given in Field Name MV, to identify the corresponding multi-value set that needs to be modified.
For e.g. if three accounts are updated in the base and the balance in the second account needs to be changed,
Field Name MV will be ‘ACCOUNT’ and Field Value MV will be the Account number in the second multi-value (e.g.109298654.
A valid value for the field from base.
